meanings.definition: Cook (food) partially or completely before its final preparation.
meanings.sent1: She precooks the pasta before adding the sauce.
meanings.sent2: The chef always precooks the vegetables for the stir-fry.
meanings.sent3: The chef precooks the rice, so it's ready to go when the orders come in.
meanings.sent4: Precooking the meat ensures it will be tender and juicy when grilled.
meanings.sent5: Precooking the potatoes makes them easier to mash later on.

meanings.definition: To prepare food in advance by cooking it partially or completely.
meanings.sent1: He precooks the chicken for tomorrow's barbecue.
meanings.sent2: The restaurant precooks the soups to save time during busy hours.
meanings.sent3: She precooks the pasta to avoid last-minute cooking stress.
meanings.sent4: Precooking the sauce allows the flavors to develop fully.
meanings.sent5: Precooking the vegetables helps to retain their nutrients.
